content: yarn for sewing sew the bill to the front of the duck s face 1 row below the eyes stuffing the bill is optional ❖ tuft of feathers on top optional take a strand of green yarn or whichever color used for the duck s head a few inches long fold it in half and make a knot in the folded end then using a crochet hook pull the knotted end down into the top of the duck s head through the hole of the ml leaving the ends sticking out the top split the strands of yarn and trim to the desired length 6 copyright mysimplicitiesbymn 2025 all rights reserved all documents and pictures are property of megan nelson mysimplicitiesbymn no part of this publication may be reproduced and/or redistributed in any way part or whole it is prohibited to use my patterns for commercial purposes thank you for respecting copyright laws after assembly the mallard duck is finished please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or concerns about the pattern simply mn25@gmail com mysimplicitiesbymn etsy shop mysimplicitiesbymn instagram mysimplicitiesmn ravelry if you sell any items made from this pattern please make sure credit for pattern is given to megan/mysimplicitiesbymn thank you & happy crocheting 7 copyright mysimplicitiesbymn 2025 all rights reserved all documents and pictures are property of megan nelson mysimplicitiesbymn no part of this publication may be reproduced and/or redistributed in any way part or whole it is prohibited to use my patterns for commercial purposes thank you for respecting copyright laws
